parsed.internal_thinking: I have placed my second settlement at node 31, which provides me with a strong mix of Wheat (9), Brick (10), and Wood (11). This complements my first settlement at node 42, which is heavily focused on Wheat (9, 9) and Ore (5). By placing my road from 31 to 41, I immediately connect my two settlements (since I already have a road from 42 to 41). This gives me a solid starting road length of 2 and creates a flexible corridor for expansion. From node 41, I can move toward node 40 to claim the Wood port or push further into the center. This setup gives me a production source for four of the five resources, with a particularly powerful Wheat engine (yielding 3 Wheat on a roll of 9). My next priority will be securing a Sheep source or utilizing a port to trade my excess Wheat. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: My economy is now balanced with strong Wheat/Ore and decent Wood/Brick. My Wheat engine is particularly powerful, yielding 3 Wheat every time a 9 is rolled. I need to secure a Sheep source or a port soon. The 3:1 port at Node 50/51 is nearby, and the Wood 2:1 port at Node 40/48 is also an option if I expand through Node 41. Watch AI_1's progress toward the Wood 12; they might compete for the northern routes.
parsed.say_outloud: I've connected my settlements! With such a strong flow of wheat and building materials, I'm feeling very optimistic about my expansion potential. Good luck getting those sheep, everyone!
